./

pg_limb_sector.pro


Routines

top source pg_limb_sector

NV/PG

result = pg_limb_sector(cd=cd, gbx=gbx, gd=gd, lon=lon, sample=sample, win_num=win_num, restore=restore, p0=p0, xor_graphics=xor_graphics, color=color, noverbose=noverbose, nodsk=nodsk, dkd=dkd, altitudes=altitudes, azimuths=azimuths, limb_pts_body=limb_pts_body, cw=cw)

Allows the user to select an image sector along lines of constant azimuth and altitude above a planet by clicking and dragging.

Return value

POINT containing points on the sector outline. The point spacing is determined by the sample keyword. The POINT object also contains the disk coordinate for each point, relative to the returned disk descriptor, and the user fields 'nrad' and 'nlon' giving the number of points in altitude and azimuth. MODIFICATION HISTORY : Spitale; 8/2006 original version

Keywords

cd in

Camera descriptor.

gbx in

Globe descriptor for the planet whose limb is to be scanned.

gd in

Generic descriptor containnig the above descriptors.

lon
sample in

Sets the grid sampling in pixels. Default is one.

win_num in

Window number of IDL graphics window in which to select box, default is current window.

restore in

Do not leave the box in the image.

p0 in

First corner of box. If set, then the routine immediately begins to drag from that point until a button is released.

xor_graphics in

If set, the sector outline is drawn and erased using xor graphics instead of a pixmap.

color in

Color to use for rectangle, default is !color.

noverbose in

If set, messages are suppressed.

nodsk in

If set, skyplane disk image points will not be included in the output POINT.

dkd

Disk desriptor in the skyplane, centered on the planet with 0 axis along the skyplane projection of the north pole. For use with pg_profile_ring.

altitudes

Array giving altitude at each sample.

azimuths

Array giving azimuth at each sample.

limb_pts_body

Body coordinates of each limb points on planet surface.

cw in

If set, azimuths are assumed to increase in the clockwise direction.
